Usage: apic create                 interactive
       apic create OPTIONS         non-interactive

  Options when creating an API definition:
  --type api                       create an API definition (default)
  --title TITLE                    title value (required)
  --name NAME                      x-ibm-name value (default derived from title)
  --version VERSION                version value (defaults to 1.0.0)
  --basepath BASEPATH              basepath value (default derived from name)
  --product PRODUCT_TITLE          generate a product definition referencing the API
  --template oauth2                use the oauth2 provider template
  --filename API_FILENAME          filename (default derived from name)

  Options when creating a product definition:
  --type product                   create a product definition
  --title TITLE                    title value (required)
  --name NAME                      name value (default derived from title)
  --version VERSION                version value (defaults to 1.0.0)
  --apis API_FILENAME ...          list of APIs to reference
  --filename PRODUCT_FILENAME      filename (default derived from name)

  Create an API interactively
  $ apic create
  API or Product (API): API
  Title: Routes
  Name (my-routes): routes
  File (routes.yaml): routes.yaml
  Basepath (/routes): /routes
  Create product [Yes]: Yes
  Product title (Routes Product): Climb On
  Product name (climbon): climbon
  Product file (climbon.yaml): climbon.yaml
  Created routes.yaml (routes:1.0.0) API definition
  Created climbon.yaml (climbon:1.0.0) product definition

  Create a product interactively
  $ apic create
  API or Product (API): Product
  Title: Climb On
  Name (climbon): climbon
  File (climbon.yaml): climbon.yaml
  Created climbon.yaml (climbon:1.0.0) product definition

  Create an API non-interactively
  $ apic create --title Routes
  Created routes.yaml (routes:1.0.0) API definition

  Create an API using the OAuth 2 provider template non-interactively
  $ apic create --title "OAuth2 Provider" --template oauth2
  Created oauth2-provider.yaml (oauth2-provider:1.0.0) API definition

  Create an API and generate a product referencing the api non-interactively
  $ apic create --title Routes --product "Climb On"
  Created routes.yaml (routes:1.0.0) API definition
  Created climbon.yaml (climbon:1.0.0) product definition

  Create a product non-interactively
  $ apic create --type product --title "Climb On"
  Created climbon.yaml (climbon:1.0.0) product definition

  Create a product referencing existing APIs non-interactively
  $ apic create --type product --title "Climb On" --apis "routes.yaml ascents.yaml"
  Created climbon.yaml (climbon:1.0.0) product definition

  Create an API and generate a product referencing the api non-interactively generating json
  $ apic create --title Routes --product "Climb On" --json
  [ { status: success,
      results: { type: api, name: routes, version: 1.0.0, filename: routes.yaml } },
    { status: success,
      results: { type: product, name: climbon, version: 1.0.0, filename: climbon.yaml } } ]
